revised_title: The Influence of Iodine and Water Vapor on the Combination of Hydrogen and Oxygen
tldr: The authors conducted experiments to study the influence of iodine and water vapor on the combination of hydrogen and oxygen. They found that iodine retards the gaseous reaction and inhibits the low-pressure explosion, while water vapor inhibits the explosion when present in large amounts. The experiments provide insights into the chemical processes occurring in the chains during the reaction.
